alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 08 at 6:41AM EDT until April 08 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northern New Jersey...and northeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in northern New Jersey...Sussex and Warren. In northeast Pennsylvania...Monroe. * WHEN...Until 930 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated an area of very heavy rainfall occurred across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell last night. - For Flat Brook at Flatbrookville: At 6:30am the stage was 7.01 feet. Flood Stage is 6 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
